lexUnit.name: locker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small lockable cupboard or compartment, typically used for clothes and personal belongings

sentence.text: It was later traced by police to the locker of club skipper Cyril Proby .
The late sub editor , a lovely Irishman called Bill Shedee , had his own solution to a prodigious thirst -- he kept his locker stacked with bottles of Double Diamond .
` He just cleared out his locker .

Can you go up and get me a vest or a towel or something from my locker ?

He crossed to his locker and opened it .
